expediciones.descripcion: Our expeditions are programs that requires an impeccable logistic from our part and an excellent physical and psychological preparation from the members of the equipment who tries to attack the summit. We are mountaineers and we know what services people need in the mountains, that is why we take care of every details in order that our clients only worry about the only thing they have to worry: to acclimate and to be kept strong to reach the summit.

salidas.descripcion: The Normal Route Aconcagua presents no technical difficulty, which is why this route is enormously attractive, allowing to reach the summit at any mountaineer in good physical preparation and proper acclimatization. Contact us in case our dates are not convenient for you, we have at our disposal enough staff and infrastructure to prepare a schedule up to you.

itinerario.descripcion: The itinerary is intended as a guideline only. Although every effort will be made to adhere to it, changes may be caused due to weather conditions, transport failure or other unforeseen events. Please be flexible if necessary.

etapas.descripcion: Pick up on the airport / Hotel in Mendoza, check in. Guides will check your equipment.
Obtaining of permits. Transfer to Penitentes. Lodging in our mountain Refuge. Preparation of the loads for the mules (B, D)
Drive to the entrance of the Park. Trek to Confluencia Camp. (B, PL, D)

etapas.copete: Confluencia / Plaza Francia (13200 feets - 4000 msnm) / Confluencia
etapas.descripcion: Trek to Plaza Francia (South Face), Lunch and return to Confluencia. (B, PL, D)

etapas.copete: Confluencia / Plaza de Mulas (14058 feets - 4260 msnm)
etapas.descripcion: Trek to Plaza de Mulas BC. Lodge in the base camp. (B, PL, D)
Día de descanso. Trek corto al Glaciar Horcones. Prácticas con crampones. (D, A, C)

etapas.copete: Trek to Mt. Bonete Summit  (16732 feets - 5100 msnm)
etapas.descripcion: Acclimatization trek to Mt. Bonete Summit and return to PM. Activity will definitely turns on all acclimatization mechanisms in the body. (B, PL, D)

etapas.copete: Plaza de Mulas / Camp 1 Canadá (16203 feets - 4910 msnm) / Plaza de Mulas
etapas.descripcion: Transportation of material to Canadá and return to Base Camp. (B, PL, D)
Resting day. (B, L, D)

etapas.copete: Plaza de Mulas / Camp 1 Canadá (16203 feets - 4910 msnm)
etapas.descripcion: Climb to Camp 1 Canadá. (B, PL, D)

etapas.copete: Camp 1 Canadá / Camp 2 Nido de Cóndores (17325 feets - 5250 msnm)
etapas.descripcion: Climb to Camp 2 Nido de Cóndores. (B, PL, D)

etapas.copete: Camp 2 Nido de Cóndores (17325 feets – 5250 msnm)
etapas.descripcion: Resting day. (B, L, D)
Extra day for bad weather conditions (B, L, D)
Extra day for bad weather conditions (B, L, D)

etapas.copete: Camp 2 Nido de Cóndores / Camp 3 Berlín - Cólera (19470 feets – 5900 msnm)
etapas.descripcion: Climb to Camp 3 Berlín - Cólera. (B, PL, D)

etapas.copete: Camp 3 Berlín - Cólera / SUMMIT (22834 feets – 6962 msnm) / Camp 3
etapas.descripcion: Climb from Camp 3 Berlín - Cólera to the SUMMIT and return to Camp. 3 (B, PL, D)

etapas.copete: Camp 3 Berlín - Cólera / Plaza de Mulas BC
etapas.descripcion: Descent to Plaza de Mulas base camp. (B, PL, D)

etapas.copete: Plaza de Mulas base camp / Puente del Inca / Mendoza
etapas.descripcion: Descent to Puente del Inca. Drive to Mendoza. Lodging in the hotel. (B, PL)
Transfer from the hotel to the airport. (B)

servicios.descripcion:
• Certified High altitude Mountain Guide
  • Two Hotel nights in Mendoza, 3* star/double occupancy with breakfast
  • Private transfer from airport to Mendoza Hotel and back
  • Assistance to obtaining climbing permit
  • Transportation in private vehicles: Mendoza - Penitentes Lodge
  • Two nights in a Mountain Refuge in Penitentes, double occupancy, (B,D)
  • Transportation from Penitentes Horcones Valley Park entrance
  • Transport of load by mules from Penitentes to Plaza de Mulas and back
  • Two days full board service in Confluencia BC
  • Full board service at Plaza de Mules BC
  • Our camps have solar energy, radios, Satellite Phone; meals are prepared following strict standards of hygiene. We also cater to vegetarians
  • All necessary food for the high camps
  • Tent for use while group is at the base camp, permanent radio communication and toilet.
  • Four season tents (The North Face, Mountain 25),MSR stoves, cookware and dishes
  • Permanent communication between base camp, Mendoza and Penitentes to be able to coordinate different logistical issues, reservations and. When necessary, rescues or evacuations.

• Ascent Permit
  • Airfare and airport taxes to and from Mendoza
  • Food and drink not mentioned in Itinerary
  • Personal porters
  • Individual gear
  • Extra costs as a result of abandoning of the expedition
  • Medical or traveler's insurance. Costs as a result of an emergency rescue.
  • Personal expenses (drinks, laundry, mail, telephone calls)
  • All other services not listed as Included

• Light underwear.
  • Long underwear.
  • Polypropylene underwear, capilene or something similar (not cotton)
  • Fleece trousers and jacket waterproof and easy to perspire; we suggest Gore-Tex or similar.
  • Note: wear trousers with lateral zipper, in order to put them on faster and easier

• Interior polypropylene gloves or similar
  • Thick fingerless glove, wool, fleece or similar
  • Gore-Tex fingerless glove cover or similar

• Confortable trekking shoes.
  • Double plastic boots, we recommend Koflach, Azolo, Iowa, etc.
  • Gaiters. Gore-Tex, Cordura.
  • Thick socks. woolen or synthetic.
  • Thin socks of smooth wool, nylon or polypropylene.

• Sunhat and balaclava.
  • Bandana or handkerchief (neck).
  • Wool ski hat.

• Light ice-ax, 60 or 70 cm, depending on the height.
  • quickly wearing crampons, 12 points with few ribbons.
  • ski sticks.
  • Climbing Helmet.

• Backpack: capacity 70 liters, rigid back, hard-wearing material with porta ice-ax and place for crampons.
  • Regular backpack.
  • Sleeping bag: high quality, duvet, to endure temperatures of -25°C
  • Sleeping pads, closed cell, neoprene or inflatable.
  • Heavy weight down jacket.
  • Gaiters Gore-Tex.
  • Water bottle and vacuum flask: capacity 1 liter, wide-mouth.
  • Head lamp (Petzel).
  • Sunglasses, 100%UV protection, with side shields, extra pair.
  • Victorinox penknife or similar.
  • Sunscreen. Minimum of spf 30-40 or full protection and lip protection.
  • Mini first-aid kit.
  • Camera.
• To transport your general gear from Penitentes-Puente de Inca to Plaza de Mulas, you need a big and resistant bag, like a duffel bag, and a small one, to leave your belongings in our store.

salidas.descripcion: The 360º expedition combines two different routes around the Aconcagua, the east face and the Northwest  face. The ascent through Vacas Valley and the descent through the Normal Route allows you to enjoy the  magnificence of the highest mountain in America.

itinerario.descripcion: The itinerary is intended as a guideline only. Although every effort will be made to adhere to it, changes may be caused due to weather conditions, transport failure or other unforeseen events. Please be flexible if necessary.

etapas.descripcion: Drive airport / Hotel in Mendoza. Instructive talk about the Mt. Aconcagua and the guides will check your equipment.
Permits. Transfer to Penitentes. Lodging in Penitentes. Preparation of the loads for the mules. (B, L, D)

etapas.copete: Penitentes / Pampa de Leñas (10230 feets - 3100 msnm)
etapas.descripcion: Drive to Quebrada de Vacas. Start of the trek to Pampa de Leñas. (B, PL, D)

etapas.copete: Pampa de Leñas / Casa de Piedra (11880 feets - 3600 msnm)
etapas.descripcion: Trek to Casa de Piedra. (B, PL, D)

etapas.descripcion: Trek to Plaza Argentina base camp. Lodging. (B, PL, D)

etapas.descripcion: Resting day in Plaza Argentina. (B, L, D)

etapas.descripcion: Trek and transportation of material to Camp 1 back to BC. (B, PL, D)

etapas.descripcion: Resting day in Plaza Argentina. (B, L, D)
Climb to Camp 1. (B, PL, D)
Trek and transportation of material to Camp 2 back to Camp 1. (B, PL, D)
Rest day in Camp 1. (B, L, D)
Extra for contingencies or as bad weather. (B, L, D)
Climb to Camp 2. (B, PL, D)
Climb to Camp Cólera on the Normal Route. (B, L, D)

etapas.copete: Camp Cólera / SUMMIT (22974 feets - 6962 msnm) / Camp 2
etapas.descripcion: Climbing day to the SUMMIT returning to Cólera. (B, PL, D)
Descent from Cólera to BC Plaza de Mulas. (B, PL, D)

etapas.descripcion: Descent from BC to the entrance. Transfer to Penitentes. Penitentes to Mendoza. Lodging in hotel. Farewell Dinner (B, PL, D)
Transfer to the Airport or Bus Station (B)

salidas.descripcion: Through this route Mt. Aconcagua is going to show us its most rustic side on the east face of the mountain. Here you will find less traffic than the north-east side. To climb Aconcagua by this route requires minimal technical skills and an excellent physical condition.

trekkings.descripcion: Trekking in Aconcagua Park rewards the visitor with a magnificent view and the exciting experience approaching to the base of the mythical South Face of Aconcagua, with its almost 3000m of altitude and covered with hanging glaciers, it is one of the largest in the world. We have 2 itineraries for you to enjoy an unforgettable experience, and to know the different base camps of Aconcagua.

salidas.nombre:
Trek to Plaza Francia
Aconcagua’s South Face
salidas.descripcion:
The Aconcagua…. Incas´s old altar dazzles us with its primitive and beautiful scenery. A unique trek inside the Andes, it´s much more than wonderful landscapes, blue skies, powerful winds and majestic clouds; much more than rocks, stars and silence… It take us right into the Stone Sentinel's kingdom.
Your adventure begins at the base of the mythical South Face of Aconcagua, with hanging glaciers and walls almost 3.000 meters tall, one of the biggest in the world.
The trip will be filled with discoveries and memories that will last a lifetime.

This trekking program is designed for people with good health and optimum fitness for example able to run or go 3 or 4 times a week (1 to 2 hours) and recently completed a doctor of psychophysical fitness

SAFETY & RESPONSIBILITY

All of our programs are planned with safety as our number one priority, taking the weather conditions or events beyond our responsibility into account, we reserve the right to change or exclude those whose health may affect the safety of the trip or activity.

itinerario.descripcion: Este itinerario está diseñado para nuestros programas de trekkings guiados. Incluye traslados, alojamiento, comidas y visitas guiadas en el Parque Provincial Aconcagua, con destino final en Plaza Francia, al pie de la imponente Pared Sur del Coloso de América.

etapas.descripcion: Encuentro en nuestra oficina en Mendoza, obtención de permisos. Traslado desde Mendoza a Penitentes en vehículo privado o bus de línea. Alojamiento en refugio de montaña 'Cruz de Caña'. Cena y desayuno incluidos.

Traslado desde Penitentes al Parque Provincial Aconcagua en vehículo privado. Check-in en Guardaparques y charla de bienvenida. Comienzo del trekking (3-4 hs). Visita a la Laguna Horcones. Breve relato sobre el hallazgo de una momia Inca en el Cerro Pirámide. Pack lunch en la Quebrada del Durazno con posible avistaje de aves. Arribo a Confluencia, distribución en campamento, descanso, paseo por alrededores y visita a las ruinas incas. Cena y pernocte. (L, M, C)

Desayuno y partida hacia Plaza Francia (6-8 hs de caminata). Vista al frente del glaciar Horcones inferior. El antiguo valle glaciario sorprende con sus colores y formaciones. En el mirador, pack lunch con vista a la Pared Sur del Aconcagua, sus glaciares colgantes y las dos cumbres. El guía explicará las rutas de escalada utilizadas por los montañistas. Regreso a Confluencia, descanso, cena y pernocte. (D, L, C)

Desayuno y descenso a Horcones (2-3 hs). Check-out en Guardaparques. Traslado al monumento natural Puente del Inca, paseo y compras de artesanías. Regreso a Mendoza en vehículo privado o bus. Despedida. (D, L)

servicios.descripcion:
• Transfer Mendoza city– Aconcagua park – Mendoza city.
  • All the meals during the program
  • Confluencia Base Camp
  • Trek to Plaza Francia
  • Professional Guide
  • Tents
  • Communication


    • Interview with your Guide a day before departure

    There will be a meeting with all participants of the hiking, the day before heading into the meeting place and time allocated for this purpose.
    Here the guide will have a personal interview with each of them to: Verify personal data and medical record staff check the equipment necessary, evacuate doubt, advice and assist the passenger in the event of having to rent the same.

    Transfer to Aconcagua Park

    The clients are going to be picked up at the meeting point and time agreed. Private transfer or public bus from Mendoza-to Aconcagua Provincial park Meals
    During the trekking you will enjoy all meals (B: breakfast / L: lunch / R: snack or reception / D: Dinner), they have been carefully planned by experts as calculating the average energy expenditure of the activities planned for each day and height above sea level in which they develop them. If you are vegetarian, celiac or requires a special diet, please contact us through your booking form so we can prepare a special menu that suits your needs.

    Confluencia Base Camp

    Our camp is designed and equipped so that our customers enjoy a comfortable stay. To do this we have a dome room (with beds and mattresses) and tents bedrooms (with mattress). The distribution of places (in bed or tent) will be made in order of their availability. In both cases the spaces are shared.
    For the service of gastronomy, we got dinning Domes which are electric light equipped with camping tables and benches, dishes and the friendly attention of our people.
    The WC service, is a structural comfortable bathroom with toilets, running water, and the right to shower with hot water.

    Our Guides

    In LANKO we believe that to succeed in our programs, the quality of the team that represents and manages us is critical. So we have a staff of professional mountain guides. They are all graduated and alumni of the prestigious EPGAMT (School of Mountain Guides and Trekking - this race is a top level Tecnicatura 2 ½ years duration.
    Communication
    We have VHF and BLU radio equipments in all of our base camps and sites of LANKO. That help us to stay in contact between Penitentes- Confluencia- Plaza de Mulas- Plaza Argentina and Mendoza. Therefore, we can respond almost inmediately to whatever issue that may arise.

• Trekking Permit
  • Mules
  • Drinks and other personal costs not mentioned in the itinerary
  • Sleeping Bag and Personal Equipment
  • Expenses for giving up the trekking, even for illness
  • Personal Insurance


    • Trekking Permit

    The formality to get the entrance permit it´s personal and the only way to enter at the Aconcagua Park. You can purchase it in the Aconcagua Visitor Centre in Mendoza city.
    Tickets are not refundable due to the different entrance fees depending on the season (low, middle and high season)

    Mules

    The mules for the transfer of loads are not included in this program. You will have to carry in your backpack, all your personal equipment , enough water and your lunch, which will be provided by the guide every day before departure.

    Drinks and other personal costs not mentioned in the itinerary

    Extra expenses like food or drinks separate from those described in the itinerary should be paid for you, as they are not included.

    Sleeping bag and Personal equipment

    Neither the technical nor the mountain equipment are included services, so you would have to buy or rent them. Take into account our guides if you need assistance.
    If you rent equipment, you will be responsible for it. Apart from that, you must give the equipment back to the mountain shop in time.

    Expenses for giving up the trekking

    If you give up the scheduled itinerary because of personal problems, mountain sickness, etc, you start taking private and individual services. In this case, you must pay for the extra expenses

    Personal insurance

    Having a personal insurance is not a fundamental requirement to do the trekking. However, if you wish to take one, we suggest that you contact an insurance company with enough time.

• 1 Comfortable 60 litres backpack
  • 1 Pair of telescopic poles (optional)
  • 1 sleeping bag ( -20° C)
  • 2 bottles for water (1 ½ liters each one)
  • Front lamp with extra batteries
  • Sunscreen (never less than FSP 45)
  • Personal first aid kit
  • Personal care elements

• Sun cap or hat
  • Shelter hat (wool or fleece)
  • A good pair of sunglasses with UV filter

• 2 Synthetic underwear shirts
  • Turtleneck of synthetic material
  • 1 Fleece jacket of alike
  • 1 Shelter jacket (down or synthetical)
  • 1 Rainproof jacket

• 1 Pair of comfortable long pant (trekking type, no jeans)
  • 1 Pair of underwear long pant
  • 1 Pair of rainproof pants

• 2 Pairs of thick socks for cold (ski type)
  • 1 Pair of comfortable and rainproof trekking boots

• 1 Pair of rainproof gloves for shelter (mitten type)
  • 1 Pair of underwear gloves

itinerario.descripcion: Este itinerario está diseñado para nuestros programas de trekkings guiados y está destinado a personas con buena salud y estado físico óptimo. Recorre uno de los caminos más impactantes del Parque Provincial Aconcagua, alcanzando los 5000 m.s.n.m. con vistas inigualables del Coloso de América.

Traslado desde Penitentes al Parque Provincial Aconcagua en vehículo privado. Check-in en Guardaparques y charla de bienvenida. Comienzo del trekking (3-4 hs). Visita a la Laguna Horcones. Relato sobre el hallazgo de una momia Inca en el Cerro Pirámide. Pack lunch en la Quebrada del Durazno. Posible avistaje de aves. Arribo a Confluencia, recepción, distribución de alojamientos, descanso, paseo y visita a ruinas incas. Cena y pernocte. (L, M, C)

Desayuno y trekking a Plaza Francia (6-8 hs). Observación del glaciar Horcones inferior. Ascenso por antiguo valle glaciario con paisajes únicos. Pack lunch en mirador con vista a las cumbres del Aconcagua y la Pared Sur. El guía explicará las rutas de ascenso de expertos montañistas. Regreso a Confluencia, descanso, cena y pernocte. (D, L, C)

Desayuno y trekking a Plaza de Mulas (8-12 hs). Almuerzo de marcha en Piedra Ibáñez. Arribo por la tarde. Check-in en Guardaparques. Recepción en el campamento y distribución de carpas dormitorio. Cena y pernocte. (D, L, M, C)

Día de descanso. Desayuno, paseo por los alrededores, oportunidad para fotografías. Almuerzo. Trekking al Glaciar Horcones Superior. Visita al antiguo campamento de Plaza de Mulas. Merienda, tiempo libre, cena y pernocte. (D, A, M, C)

etapas.copete: Plaza de Mulas / Cerro Bonete / Plaza de Mulas
etapas.descripcion: Desayuno y ascenso al Cerro Bonete (8 hs). Alcanzamos los 5000 m.s.n.m. con vistas majestuosas del Aconcagua. Retorno al campamento, refrigerio, cena y pernocte. (D, L, M, C)

Desayuno y descenso a Horcones (8-10 hs). Check-out en Guardaparques. Traslado para visitar el monumento natural Puente del Inca, paseo por los alrededores y artesanías. Regreso a Mendoza en vehículo privado o bus de línea. Despedida. (D, L)

servicios.descripcion:
• Transfer Mendoza city– Aconcagua park – Mendoza city.
  • All the meals during the program
  • Confluencia Base Camp
  • Trek to Plaza Francia
  • Professional Guide
  • Tents
  • Communication


    • Interview with your Guide a day before departure

    There will be a meeting with all participants of the hiking, the day before heading into the meeting place and time allocated for this purpose.
    Here the guide will have a personal interview with each of them to: Verify personal data and medical record staff check the equipment necessary, evacuate doubt, advice and assist the passenger in the event of having to rent the same.

    Transfer to Aconcagua Park

    The clients are going to be picked up at the meeting point and time agreed. Private transfer or public bus from Mendoza-to Aconcagua Provincial park Meals
    During the trekking you will enjoy all meals (B: breakfast / L: lunch / R: snack or reception / D: Dinner), they have been carefully planned by experts as calculating the average energy expenditure of the activities planned for each day and height above sea level in which they develop them. If you are vegetarian, celiac or requires a special diet, please contact us through your booking form so we can prepare a special menu that suits your needs.

    Confluencia Base Camp

    Our camp is designed and equipped so that our customers enjoy a comfortable stay. To do this we have a dome room (with beds and mattresses) and tents bedrooms (with mattress). The distribution of places (in bed or tent) will be made in order of their availability. In both cases the spaces are shared.
    For the service of gastronomy, we got dinning Domes which are electric light equipped with camping tables and benches, dishes and the friendly attention of our people.
    The WC service, is a structural comfortable bathroom with toilets, running water, and the right to shower with hot water.

    Our Guides

    In LANKO we believe that to succeed in our programs, the quality of the team that represents and manages us is critical. So we have a staff of professional mountain guides. They are all graduated and alumni of the prestigious EPGAMT (School of Mountain Guides and Trekking - this race is a top level Tecnicatura 2 ½ years duration.
    Communication
    We have VHF and BLU radio equipments in all of our base camps and sites of LANKO. That help us to stay in contact between Penitentes- Confluencia- Plaza de Mulas- Plaza Argentina and Mendoza. Therefore, we can respond almost inmediately to whatever issue that may arise.

• Trekking Permit
  • Mules
  • Drinks and other personal costs not mentioned in the itinerary
  • Sleeping Bag and Personal Equipment
  • Expenses for giving up the trekking, even for illness
  • Personal Insurance


    • Trekking Permit

    The formality to get the entrance permit it´s personal and the only way to enter at the Aconcagua Park. You can purchase it in the Aconcagua Visitor Centre in Mendoza city.
    Tickets are not refundable due to the different entrance fees depending on the season (low, middle and high season)

    Mules

    The mules for the transfer of loads are not included in this program. You will have to carry in your backpack, all your personal equipment , enough water and your lunch, which will be provided by the guide every day before departure.

    Drinks and other personal costs not mentioned in the itinerary

    Extra expenses like food or drinks separate from those described in the itinerary should be paid for you, as they are not included.

    Sleeping bag and Personal equipment

    Neither the technical nor the mountain equipment are included services, so you would have to buy or rent them. Take into account our guides if you need assistance.
    If you rent equipment, you will be responsible for it. Apart from that, you must give the equipment back to the mountain shop in time.

    Expenses for giving up the trekking

    If you give up the scheduled itinerary because of personal problems, mountain sickness, etc, you start taking private and individual services. In this case, you must pay for the extra expenses

    Personal insurance

    Having a personal insurance is not a fundamental requirement to do the trekking. However, if you wish to take one, we suggest that you contact an insurance company with enough time.

• 1 Comfortable 60 litres backpack
  • 1 Pair of telescopic poles (optional)
  • 1 sleeping bag ( -20° C)
  • 2 bottles for water (1 ½ liters each one)
  • Front lamp with extra batteries
  • Sunscreen (never less than FSP 45)
  • Personal first aid kit
  • Personal care elements

• Sun cap or hat
  • Shelter hat (wool or fleece)
  • A good pair of sunglasses with UV filter

• 2 Synthetic underwear shirts
  • Turtleneck of synthetic material
  • 1 Fleece jacket of alike
  • 1 Shelter jacket (down or synthetical)
  • 1 Rainproof jacket

• 1 Pair of comfortable long pant (trekking type, no jeans)
  • 1 Pair of underwear long pant
  • 1 Pair of rainproof pants

• 2 Pairs of thick socks for cold (ski type)
  • 1 Pair of comfortable and rainproof trekking boots

• 1 Pair of rainproof gloves for shelter (mitten type)
  • 1 Pair of underwear gloves
